feed.title: Ryan Wise
feed.subtitle: I'm a passionate programmer, ever since I was 12 and picked up C++. I've been interested in video game programming, networking, linux, full-stack dev and anything low level. I also have a love for hardware and electronics.

entry.title: Binary Keyboard Project
entry.content:
I started this project to help teach binary. This is a useful and fun way for someone who doesn’t quite understand how binary to ascii works. I’m switching out the tactile buttons used for mechanical key switches for an easier experience typing.

Obviously it is not very practical as a standalone keyboard as typing 8 bits for every one keystroke is tiresome. Here is the code if you’re interested, I’ll have a tutorial soon!

Github
entry.summary: A simple keyboard I made that will take an 8bit binary string and convert it into it's ASCII equivalent if there is one

entry.title: First Post!
entry.content:
Hi all!

This is my first blog post with Jekyll for my blog. I hope to add an interface that will let me post and build jekyll without manually creating a markdown file and running:

jekyll build --destination ../www/blog

but for now I will suffer with it.

If you don’t know what Jekyll is, it’s an awesome static site blog generator built with Ruby and it’s open source! Fuck yeah. Here is the link if you’re interested. jekyll

Current theme is the Moon theme by TaylanTatli
entry.summary: A simple first post on Jekyll
